summary: This document is an email chain between defense attorney Michael Bachner and federal prosecutors regarding an attorney proffer for an unnamed female client (Ms. =I). The emails discuss scheduling a meeting for the client to be interviewed, confirm legal protections for the proffer, and clarify details about the client's visits to Jeffrey Epstein's properties.

persons.name: Michael Bachner

persons.name: Ms. =I
persons.context: Unnamed female client of Michael Bachner who is the subject of an attorney proffer to federal prosecutors; the emails discuss her potential interview and clarify her visits to Epstein properties.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned indirectly through references to his properties (New York mansion, Palm Beach residence, New Mexico ranch, Little St. James Island, Great St. James Island, Paris residence) that the client may have visited.

events.title: Attorney Proffer Meeting

events.title: Proposed Client Interview
events.description: Proposed date for federal prosecutors to interview Ms. =I directly, following the attorney proffer.

keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing negotiations between defense counsel and federal prosecutors regarding an attorney proffer for an unnamed female client (Ms. =I) in the Epstein investigation.
Prosecutors indicate that the attorney proffers received "haven't caused us to change our view of Ms. =I's status," suggesting she remains a person of interest.
The emails seek clarification about whether Ms. =I visited multiple Epstein properties including his New Mexico ranch, Little St. James Island, Great St. James Island, and Paris residence.
Legal protections under Federal Rules of Evidence 408 and 410 are explicitly discussed and confirmed for the attorney proffer communications.
The client reportedly stayed in Epstein's Paris apartment with "her us and on one occasion," though the exact meaning is unclear due to potential dictation errors.
